snippet: Lynn Shelton, the director of “Your Sister’s Sister,” talks about her Claire Denis epiphany, when she realized, at the age of 37, that the door to directing a feature film had not shut for her yet.
abstract: Director Lynn Shelton, who only started making feature films at age 40, is an integral part of the independent film community in Seattle; her sixth movie Your Sister's Sister is set for release and she has started production on her seventh.
lead_paragraph: Lynn Shelton, the director of “Your Sister’s Sister,” talks about her Claire Denis epiphany, when she realized, at the age of 37, that the door to directing a feature film had not shut for her yet.

headline.seo: Lynn Shelton, Director of ‘Your Sister’s Sister’
headline.main: Scriptless in Seattle: A Filmmaker’s Map
headline.print_headline: Scriptless in Seattle: A Filmmaker’s Map
